christian seruant hee doe seruant shall bee taken shall bee set canon 65 libertie bishop haue benefited church proper donation owne good empouerish canon 66 church setting liberty church seruantes thing hee presume doe successour shall reduce seruants againe possession church iniquitie without right hath absolued bishop setteth seruant libertie hauing first canon 67 permutation set another like worth merite place shall denie libertie foresaide seruant either accuse beare witnesse church whereinto seruant else hee shall forfeit libertie bee reduced former seruile condition church hee would haue harmed meane time permutation aforesaide shall stand firme stable hee hath augmented churchrentes either conferring acquiring augmentation vnto hath libertie canon 68 set churchseruantes libertie one particulare man estate vsurped kingdome wherein likewise one succeedeth another let v see romane emperour long consisted owne full strength hinder attemptes antichrist first man admitted bishop rome long time without consent emperour secondlie inuestment bishop staffe ring beeing likewise emperours hand excessiue pride romane bishop euen called uniuersall bishop mightilie borne downe thirdly long emperours kept owne hand power conuocating generall nationall councels bishop rome acknowledged romane emperours soueraine lordes emperours bereaued forementioned rightes palinurus storme weather cast ship rudder violence tempest washen handes thing turned vp side downe shall heare god willing subsequent word wherein prophesieth letteth taken way romane empire shall bee vtterly weakened cannot make resistance antichrist stoupeth vnder might adoreth vicare christ cānot erre god earth content crowned make oathe alleadgeance pope base estate emperours late dayes golde turned drosse might dominion seruile subjection vnto antichrist shortly comprised verse rom tibi serui fuerant domini dominorum seruorum serui nunc tibi sunt domini romane empire farre deuested auncient glorie whereas
